001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump;
002
003import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.json.JsonHtmlDumper;
004import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.json.JsonSvgDumper;
005import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.json.JsonTxtDumper;
006import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.Highlight;
007import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.RenderSpec;
008import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.yaml.YamlHtmlDumper;
009import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.yaml.YamlSvgDumper;
010import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.yaml.YamlTxtDumper;
011
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.FileOutputStream;
014import java.io.IOException;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import java.util.function.Function;
018
019import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.JacksonTree.DEFAULT_JACKSON_TREE;
020
021/**
022 * Interface to represent any Java-Object in most popular hierarchical structures (JSON and YAML)
023 * and with suitable output formats (TXT, HTML, SVG) with a flexible way to control the highlighting of elements.
024 * Together with 3 most popular Java-API approaches (String, Std-Out and File) we have a multiple ways
025 * and a multiple API-methods that the current interface exposes.
026 * <hr/>
027 * It's also recommended to use methods from corresponding utility-classes.
028 *
029 * @see PrintUtils for standard output into console
030 * @see DumpUtils for output (dump) just as a string
031 * @see ToFileUtils for output into target file at local file-system
032 */
033public interface ObjectPrinter {
034
035    /**
036     * Default instance of {@link StdOut} that uses the default {@link JacksonTree}
037     */
038    StdOut DEFAULT_STD_OUT = new StdOut();
039
040    /**
041     * TODO: clear the debugging garbage below:
042     * <dl>
043     *     <dd><i><u>usage {@code #1}:</u></i></dd>
044     *     <dt>
045     *         description of usage <b>#1</b><br/>
046     *         ... some details ...
047     *     </dt>
048     *     <dd><i><u>usage {@code #2}:</u></i></dd>
049     *     <dt>
050     *         description of usage <b>{@code #2}</b>
051     *         <pre>some explanation inside PRE</pre>
052     *     </dt>
053     *     <dd><i><u>usage #3</u></i></dd>
054     *     <dt>{@snippet class="org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.ObjectPrinterTest"}</dt>
055     *     <dd><i><u>usage {@code #4} (snippet with fragment):</u></i></dd>
056     *     <dt>{@snippet class="org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.ToFileUtils" region="saveAsJsonTxt"}</dt>
057     * </dl>
058     *
059     * @param objToPrint an instance of Java-Object to print
060     * @param renderSpec rendering details and highlight-rules
061     */
062    void printAsJsonTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
063
064    void printAsJsonHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
065
066    void printAsJsonSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
067
068    void printAsYamlTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
069
070    void printAsYamlHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
071
072    void printAsYamlSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec);
073
074    default void printAsJsonTxt(Object objToPrint) {
075        printAsJsonTxt(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));  // <-- TODO: think about passing "Highlight.DEFAULT"
076    }
077
078    default void printAsJsonHtml(Object objToPrint) {
079        printAsJsonHtml(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));
080    }
081
082    default void printAsJsonSvg(Object objToPrint) {
083        printAsJsonSvg(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));
084    }
085
086    default void printAsYamlTxt(Object objToPrint) {
087        printAsYamlTxt(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));  // <-- TODO: think about passing "Highlight.DEFAULT"
088    }
089
090    default void printAsYamlHtml(Object objToPrint) {
091        printAsYamlHtml(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));
092    }
093
094    default void printAsYamlSvg(Object objToPrint) {
095        printAsYamlSvg(objToPrint, new RenderSpec(Highlight.NONE));
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * This Java-record is a kind of element in multidimensional virtual methods' table,
100     * which acts as a bridge between two hierarchies of different implementations of:<ul>
101     *     <li>{@link TreeDumper.Node} (the default factory is {@link JacksonTree#DEFAULT_JACKSON_TREE})</li>
102     *     <li>{@link ObjectPrinter} - {@link StdOut StdOut}, {@link ToString ToString} and {@link ToFile ToFile}</li>
103     * </ul>
104     * Further interaction two hierarchies are performed via well known and very popular
105     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visitor_pattern">Visitor pattern</a>
106     *
107     * @param dumperNodeFunc a factory to create a root {@link TreeDumper.Node} from the object to dump
108     * @param dumperFactory a factory to create a proper instance of {@link TreeDumper}
109     */
110    record UnitOp(
111        Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc,
112        BiFunction<PrintStream, RenderSpec, TreeDumper> dumperFactory
113    ) {
114        void printStdOut(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
115            print(System.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
116        }
117        void print(PrintStream out, Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
118            TreeDumper.Node root = dumperNodeFunc.apply(objToPrint);
119            TreeDumper dumper = dumperFactory.apply(out, renderSpec);
120            dumper.acceptRoot(root);
121        }
122    }
123
124    /**
125     *
126     */
127    class StdOut implements ObjectPrinter {
128        private final Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc;
129
130        public StdOut() {
131            this(DEFAULT_JACKSON_TREE::dumperNode);
132        }
133
134        public StdOut(Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc) {
135            this.dumperNodeFunc = dumperNodeFunc;
136        }
137
138        @Override
139        public void printAsJsonTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
140            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonTxtDumper::new);
141            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
142        }
143
144        @Override
145        public void printAsJsonHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
146            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonHtmlDumper::new);
147            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
148        }
149
150        @Override
151        public void printAsJsonSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
152            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonSvgDumper::new);
153            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
154        }
155
156        @Override
157        public void printAsYamlTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
158            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlTxtDumper::new);
159            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
160        }
161
162        @Override
163        public void printAsYamlHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
164            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlHtmlDumper::new);
165            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
166        }
167
168        @Override
169        public void printAsYamlSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
170            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlSvgDumper::new);
171            unitOp.printStdOut(objToPrint, renderSpec);
172        }
173    }
174
175    /**
176     *
177     */
178    class ToString implements ObjectPrinter {
179        private final StringBuilderOut out = StringBuilderOut.create();
180        private final Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc;
181
182        public ToString() {
183            this(DEFAULT_JACKSON_TREE::dumperNode);
184        }
185
186        public ToString(Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc) {
187            this.dumperNodeFunc = dumperNodeFunc;
188        }
189
190        public StringBuilder stringBuilder() {
191            return this.out.stringBuilder();
192        }
193
194        @Override
195        public String toString() {
196            return this.out.toString();
197        }
198
199        @Override
200        public void printAsJsonTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
201            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonTxtDumper::new);
202            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
203        }
204
205        @Override
206        public void printAsJsonHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
207            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonHtmlDumper::new);
208            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
209        }
210
211        @Override
212        public void printAsJsonSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
213            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonSvgDumper::new);
214            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
215        }
216
217        @Override
218        public void printAsYamlTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
219            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlTxtDumper::new);
220            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
221        }
222
223        @Override
224        public void printAsYamlHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
225            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlHtmlDumper::new);
226            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
227        }
228
229        @Override
230        public void printAsYamlSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
231            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlSvgDumper::new);
232            unitOp.print(this.out, objToPrint, renderSpec);
233        }
234    }
235
236    /**
237     *
238     */
239    class ToFile implements ObjectPrinter {
240        private final File file;
241        private final Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc;
242
243        public ToFile(File file) {
244            this(file, DEFAULT_JACKSON_TREE::dumperNode);
245        }
246
247        public ToFile(File file, Function<Object, TreeDumper.Node> dumperNodeFunc) {
248            this.file = file;
249            this.dumperNodeFunc = dumperNodeFunc;
250        }
251
252        PrintStream filePrintStream() {
253            try {
254                return new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream(file));
255            } catch (IOException ioEx) {
256                throw new IllegalStateException("could not print to file " + file, ioEx);
257            }
258        }
259
260        @Override
261        public void printAsJsonTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
262            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonTxtDumper::new);
263            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
264        }
265
266        @Override
267        public void printAsJsonHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
268            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonHtmlDumper::new);
269            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
270        }
271
272        @Override
273        public void printAsJsonSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
274            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, JsonSvgDumper::new);
275            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
276        }
277
278        @Override
279        public void printAsYamlTxt(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
280            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlTxtDumper::new);
281            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
282        }
283
284        @Override
285        public void printAsYamlHtml(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
286            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlHtmlDumper::new);
287            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
288        }
289
290        @Override
291        public void printAsYamlSvg(Object objToPrint, RenderSpec renderSpec) {
292            UnitOp unitOp = new UnitOp(dumperNodeFunc, YamlSvgDumper::new);
293            unitOp.print(this.filePrintStream(), objToPrint, renderSpec);
294        }
295    }
296}
